messages.content: Order the capitals of the german states by the number of inhabitants

The five biggest cities of Germany are Berlin, Hamburg, Munich, Cologne and Frankfurt am Main. The states with the five biggest cities are North Rhine-Westphalia, Bavaria, Baden-Württemberg, Hessen and Berlin.

The biggest state by area is Bavaria with 5.9 million inhabitants. The smallest state is Berlin with 3.7 million inhabitants.
Germany has 16 states. Make a list of all 16 states and their capitals and their capital's population, ordered by the population of their capitals

North Rhine-Westphalia
Bavaria
Baden-Württemberg
Hessen
Berlin
Hamburg
Munich
Cologne
Frankfurt am Main
Düsseldorf
Essen
Reutlingen
Karlsruhe
Mannheim
Stuttgart
Nuremberg
